charges.charge_description: 21:846 CONSPIRACY TO DISTRIBUTE NARCOTICS-Conspiracy to possess with intent to distribute a quantity of cocaine, a Schedule II controlled substance, in violation of 21:841(a)(1) (1ss)

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the US Bureau of Prisons for a term of one hundred twenty (120) months with credit given for time already served in Federal custody. This term is to run concurrently with the State sentence the defendant is now serving. The defendant shall pay a special assessment fee of $100.00 in accordance with the Bureau of Prisons'Financial Responsibility Program. The Court directs that the Preliminary Order of Forfeiture filed on August 29, 1997 by the Government be incorporated into this Judgment and Commitment. Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be placed on supervised release for a term of five (5) years and shall comply with the Standard Conditions and the following Special Conditions: 1) Shall participate in an inpatient/outpatient drug and alcohol abuse treatment program to include urinalysis testing as directed by the US Probation Officer 2) Shall pay any remaining special assessment fee within ninety (90) days of release from custody. The Court directs that the Preliminary Order of Forfeiture filed on 8/29/97 by the Government shall be incorporated into this Judgment and Commitment. The defendant has already paid the Special Assessment fee. The Court recommends that upon completioin of the State sentence the defendant is now serving, that he be designated to the Federal Correctional Institution in Estill, South Carolina. EOD 11/25/97 (1ss)

21:846 CONSPIRACY TO DISTRIBUTE NARCOTICS-Conspiracy to distribute and to distribute a quantity of cocaine, a Schedule II controlled substance, in violation of 21:841(a)(1) (1)

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby placed on Probation for a term of five (5) years and shall pay a special assessment fee of $100.00. The defendant shall also comply with the additional conditions: 1) Shall be placed on Home Confinement with electronic monitoring for the first six (6) months of probation. 2) That the defendant complete his GED Program. 3) That the defendant pay the special assessment fee within seven (7) days from the date of this Judgment. Fine is waived due to defendant's inability to pay. Court departs from guideline range upon motion of the Government due to the defendant's substantial assistance. (1)
